summary: The term "aperitif" refers to a category of beverages typically consumed before a meal to stimulate the appetite. Within the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, aperitifs are classified under the broader category of beverages and sugar. The regulation of such beverages is essential for ensuring consumer safety, quality standards, and proper labeling. The EU has established specific directives governing the production and marketing of alcoholic beverages, including aperitifs, to harmonize practices across member states. This regulatory oversight aims to protect consumers while promoting fair competition within the beverage industry, ensuring that all products meet established safety and quality criteria.
